wikipedia_page.main: Philip Pleydell-Bouverie (21 October 1788 – 27 May 1872), was a British Whig politician.

response: *Maria (27 November 1862), who married the Hon. Philip Pleydell-Bouverie MP. They had five children.
*Philip Pleydell-Bouverie was 68 when he returned to the house after a 24-year absence in 1857 as member for Berkshire. He was previously MP for Downton 1831–32.

response: *Jane Seymour (d. 18 September 1892), m. 21 August 1847 Philip Pleydell-Bouverie, of Brymore (21 April 1821 – 10 March 1890), son of Hon. Philip Pleydell-Bouverie, and had issue

response: He was Tory MP for Cockermouth from 1826 to 1831.  He succeeded, and was duly succeeded, by Sir John Lowther, 2nd Baronet, of Swillington.  He served alongside William Carus Wilson (from 1821 to 1826), Laurence Peel (from 1827 to 1830), and Philip Pleydell-Bouverie (from 1830 to 1831).
